word_mean: 癔病，歇斯底里：这是一个目前含混不清的用语，用来表示：i)典型的癔病，或Briquet综合征，为女性的一种病，其特征是：病人陈述有多种躯体性病症，但显然并非由于器质性病变所致，病程缓慢而有起伏，许多病人常有“转换性症状”(情绪转换为躯体症状)，很像神经性病症(癫痫发作、麻痹、运动障碍、感觉缺失、失明、失音)，或“分裂性”现象，(记忆缺失和神游症)。过去曾把这病看作是躯体病(古希腊人把它看作是子宫移位，故得名)
ii)癔病性神经官能症，根据其优势症状，可分为转换型和分裂型，属于神经机能病
以精神抑郁，心中烦乱，无故悲伤欲哭，哭笑无常，呵欠频作为主要表现的情志疾病。

sentence.Network_en: All the lights went off, and mass hysteria broke out.
sentence.Network_cn: 所有的灯都熄灭了，大家都变得歇斯底里起来。

sentence.Network_en: There's a very thin dividing line between joviality and hysteria.
sentence.Network_cn: 激动和歇斯底里之间就一线之隔。

sentence.Network_en: No one could help getting carried away by the hysteria.
sentence.Network_cn: 所有人都不由自主地受到狂热情绪的感染。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 歇斯底里歇斯底里（Hysteria）又称癔病。由精神刺激或不良暗示引起的一类神经精神障碍。

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 19th cent.: from Latin hystericus (see hysteric)

entry.tran: （一群人的）情绪失控，狂野情绪的爆发
entry.def: Hysteria among a group of people is a state of uncontrolled excitement, anger, or panic.

example.ex: No one could help getting carried away by the hysteria...
example.tran: 所有人都不由自主地受到狂热情绪的感染。

example.ex: Several were hurt in the panic. 'It was mass hysteria,' said Rev John Borders.
example.tran: 数人在恐慌中受了伤。“人们都疯了，”约翰·博德斯牧师说。

entry.def: A person who is suffering from hysteria is in a state of violent and disturbed emotion as a result of shock.

example.ex: By now, she was screaming, completely overcome with hysteria.
example.tran: 现在她正在尖叫，完全处于癔病发作状态。

means.word_mean: 3. neurotic disorder characterized by violent emotional outbreaks and disturbances of sensory and motor functions

auth_sentence.content: This is not Malthusian hysteria, it is fact.
auth_sentence.res_content: This is not Malthusian hysteria, it is fact.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This is not Malthusian hysteria, it is fact.

auth_sentence.content: You can live in hysteria if you so choose.
